subject: sick as a dog
event:
If I've been quiet here of late, it's because I am presently sick as a dog.

(Why do we say that anyway?  Are dogs usually sick?  Do hotcakes sell especially well?  Ah, never mind... )

Flu, most likely.  Fever, headache, lots and lots of coughing, and a horrendous sore throat.

It's bloody miserable.  My own fault.  I neglected to get my flu shot this year.

Nothing to do but sweat it out.  Excuse me, I'm off to bed again.

comments.article:
urg. that sounds bad.
hope you'll get better soon. make sure to sweat the fever out, aye?
It does sound like flu, doesn't it?  Get well soon!
Stop being sick, I heard it makes you ill.
Yeah, and life in general is a bloody lethal sexually transmitted disease.
And you just know that "sleeping like a baby" was never coined by a parent....hope you feel better soon.

Ugh. Nasty flu, I think.

Get bed rest, see a doctor, drink lot of liquids (at least that's what my doctor often advices me to do).

Get well soon!

the phrase seems to have roots only in humans desire to anthropromorphize dogs, sadly it seems that the primary way we do this is with negative characteristics. Such as sick, tired, etc. just why we choose these traits to append dog to is beyond me, they are supposed to be our best friend after all.

Hope you feel better soon, make sure to get plenty of vitamin c, garlic, and all those other immune system boosters.
Hope you feel better soon.
That sucks a lot. :(  I hope you feel better soon.
Sending get well vibes your way ....
Get well soon!
Feel Better Soon!

It might sound nasty, and I don't know if you're even able to keep anything down at the moment, but try eating some garlic cloves and onions.  That always ends up helping me immensely when I get sick (given I can keep it down).
comments.subject: Feel better!

comments.article:
Get well soon!

Because I'm a 'net junkie and I like learning new things:

There are several expressions of the form sick as a ..., that date from the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries. Sick as a dog is actually the oldest of them, recorded from 1705; it is probably no more than an attempt to give force to a strongly worded statement of physical unhappiness. It was attached to a dog, I would guess, because dogs often seem to have been linked to things considered unpleasant or undesirable; down the years they have had an incredibly bad press, linguistically speaking (think of dog tired, dog in the manger, dog’s breakfast, go to the dogs, dog Latin — big dictionaries have long entries about all the ways that dog has been used in a negative sense).

(Source)
Blast! Beaten to it. I found the same source. That is actually a hard idiom to pin down. I was surprised at how little I found.
I think hotcakes sell either very quickly or not at all..because then they just aren't hotcakes anymore.

hmm, a very interesting point... ;)

To GRRM: I'd suggest Odwalla Strawberry C Monster (and not just cause I used to work at Odwalla) that stuff tastes like strawberry pez and is loaded with vitamin C (though it might be too citrus-y for a sore throat). Good stuff. Eat lotsa ginseng and garlic, too
sending good vibes from Virginia.  Feel better soon!
Get well soon, Mr. Grrm!
VITAMIN WATER! I swear by that stuff. And Airborne. Take a nice long Sauna with a dunk in ice water if you can too. That always helps me.

Best wishes and get well soon! The weather this year isn't helping kill off all the nasty germs, at least here on the east coast.... Too warm to kill them earlier and then turning freakishly cold, making us all huddle inside sharing germs again instead of being out enjoying spring type weather. :(

I, as well as everyone else, hope you make a speedy recovery. There is a product that you may want to try called Airborne. It is sold at Walgreen's (their brand is Walborne) and the like. It always helps me within a few days when I'm sick. Good luck sir. Fair-thee-well. -Tristan
comments.subject: Get well soon!

comments.article: Hope you feel better soon! *sends healing vibes*

big breakfasts and oj

Get well soon!

:-( Sorry.
(Chicken soup. Juice and more juice. Vitamin C. Echinacea.)
Take care of yourself, please.
Good Journey...towards health.

I suggest smoking some good dope and relaxing. Unless it hurts your throat in which case brownies are always a good idea! (i'm not really known for giving good advice, sorry Grrm, but you are my hero!)
